urlLink Lumiere Restaurant ?? Relais Gourmand Lumi?re is a combination between European elegance, North American flair and Asian minimalism. Robert Feenie's cuisine reflects this eclectic style. For this young Canadian chef, the simplest cuisine is the most complex. "I hope my food speaks the French I love, the Japanese and Chinese I hear around me in Vancouver and the Canadian I am." Since it opened in 1995, the Lumi?re Restaurant and Chef Robert Feenie have received accolades from notable food critics around the world. Lumi?re has been awarded Vancouver's Best Restaurant and Best French Restaurant awards for an unprecedented six years in a row. In November 2000, Lumi?re became the first freestanding restaurant in Canada to receive the Relais Gourmand designation. An honor reserved for those who specifically cater to the passions of the art of living, quality, refinement and a sense of the exceptional.

urlLink amarcord.ca Amarcord ( I Remember ) is a Vancouver restaurant specializing in authentic dishes from Italy's Emilia - Romagna region. Try Risotto! Bigoli al Gambero 15.95 Sauteed Tiger prawns with garlic in a light Pernod cream sauce.

urlLink Share Clip Share Clip is a small utility program to share the text portion of the clipboard between PC, Mac and Linux computers. This allows you to copy and paste between two computers the same as you would on one computer.
Did some research on the search engine: urlLink Topix.net Weblog: The Secret Source of Google's Power urlLink The Google File System urlLink searchenginewatch.com

urlLink International PHP Magazine - Cutting-Edge Technologies for Web Professionals urlLink Vancouver PHP User Group The Vancouver PHP Association holds monthly meetings on the second Thursday of every month. Meetings usually start at 6:30, but it is a good idea to show up a few minutes early. The venue is generously donated by ActiveState, and is held in their offices in downtown Vancouver at 580 Granville Street. Each month a new talk is given with topics ranging from XDebug by Derick Rethans to Rasmus Lerdorf presenting 'Intro to PHP, Tips, Tricks and Performance'. The meetings generally cover technical topics relating to PHP development, deployment and use in professional applications. There is no charge for the meetings and we welcome anyone interested in PHP to contribute to our open discussion with some of the top industry professionals within the PHP community. We occasionally hold social gatherings which provide a great avenue to get to network with other professionals around Vancouver, and traditionally with guest speakers as well.

urlLink Storyeum Storyeum is a multi-media, multi-sensory, storytelling experience set in a unique underground theatre in Vancouver's historic Gastown. Enjoy the engrossing, spectacular history of British Columbia; compelling dramas, humour and action brought to life by powerful performers, spectacular sets and spellbinding 21st Century entertainment technology.

Did a little search today and found some funny references: urlLink Modal Dialogs in JavaScript Find this function during JavaScript research: a modal window is a child pop-up window that restrict your access to it, before you can go back and touch the main parent page again. Hmmm could be useful yet annoying when people don't why suddently the parent page is locked :( urlLink kirupa.com - Creating a Borderless Window Wow now this is call annoying: your own screen will be covered by a big DIV. urlLink flashloaded.com Alot of funny and powerful Flash clips. Try the Flash mp3 player! So fast!

urlLink VhqOnline.ca This is a new movie rental service that customer can choose a movie online, and then the company will mail you the movie via Canada Post. You can watch the movie whenever you want, no due date. After finishing the thing and you feel like returning it, just mail it back to the company, and then you're good to rent a new one.

Ka is one of the million Friendster's scam that unlucky Mimi encountered recently. He uses Friendster to get knowing 69 people, mostly girls, trying to get dating with them. Hmmm...read the conversation, what can I say :) [03:31:22 PM] (8) 2xme? ~: ex-ex: opened tutor center. ex: programmer. [03:31:44 PM] ka: programmer at mircosoft? [03:31:58 PM] ka: which tutor center? [03:32:28 PM] (8) 2xme? ~: iono which tutoring center. my ex-ex's getting married in sept, that's all i know [03:32:46 PM] (8) 2xme? ~: programmer at some company lor~ not MS.... haha....not everyone can get to MS! if not i'm working in MS now la hahahaha what the~ [03:33:05 PM] ka: then u 2 are not that good in studying lah [03:33:14 PM] ka: nearly all my friends got into ms [03:33:19 PM] (8) 2xme? ~: haha really? [03:38:34 PM] ka: we never talk about WHY U are not in MS [03:38:41 PM] ka: u just grad [03:39:00 PM] ka: why do u always have to twist what I am saying [03:39:20 PM] (8) 2xme? ~: i think ur making assumptions about me along the way..... but u won't admit it [03:39:31 PM] (8) 2xme? ~: ka says: then u 2 are not that good in studying lah [03:39:33 PM] ka: first..I said that my friends are in [03:39:34 PM] (8) 2xme? ~: ...i'll always remember that [03:39:38 PM] ka: and u said that your friends were in too [03:39:44 PM] ka: but they are not that smart [03:39:52 PM] ka: so I explained that everyone could write a test at that time [03:39:55 PM] ka: that's why [03:39:59 PM] ka: they may have the brain [03:40:09 PM] (8) 2xme? ~: u didn't say "at that time". [03:44:10 PM] ka: face the truth [03:44:21 PM] ka: if I say that u are a female, u are [03:44:25 PM] ka: that's not an assumption [03:44:28 PM] (8) 2xme? ~: i have friends who are not the bunch of people who are hanging around me, and they own their own businesses [03:44:31 PM] ka: that's the truth [03:44:34 PM] (8) 2xme? ~: right.....haha..... Today I spent a wonderful Sunny Sunday with May and Edith visiting the Horseshoe bay, Squamish and Shannon Falls. Here are some pictures we took: urlLink 2004-Aug-01: May and Edith's Sunday Adventure I'm sure that Edith had a very good time :P Lets look for pretty scenery again this summer!
